I'm working in the desktop editor. My question is this:

If I include images in my game, are they embedded in the code or, when I upload the game to the server here, do I need to also upload the images. 

And if I need to upload the images, do they need to have the same file path that they do on my machine? Or do all images need to be in the same directory as the game file? or something else?

Posts.EditableText:
If I remember what was said (I've not published a game yet, lol):

I think you specify a folder/path/location for the upload, which means you got to have your 'xxx.aslx' game file, your 'xxx.aslx' library files, and/or your image files, all within this upload folder/path/location. Your image/music/sound/etc media files and library files must be uploaded with your game file, the quest server will then compile/link them into the 'xxx.quest' file for online use on server and downloadable.

There is a "publish" option under the tools menu. When you use that, Quest will package all the images etc. in the game folder into one file for upload.
https://github.com/ThePix/quest/wiki/Publishing-Quest-games-(inc.-size-limitations)
